      • batchUpsert

        public void batchUpsert(java.util.Map<BlueKey,T> values)
                 throws BlueDbException
        Description copied from interface: BlueCollection
        Inserts or replaces the given key value pairs. Batch methods are much more efficient than calling non-batch methods many times.
        Specified by:
        batchUpsert in interface BlueCollection<T extends java.io.Serializable>
        Parameters:
        values - the key value pairs to insert. Key types must match the keyType specified when the collection was created.
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if the key types do not match the type specified when the collection was created

        Description copied from interface: BlueCollection
        Deletes the values for the given keys. Batch methods are much more efficient than calling non-batch methods many times.
        Specified by:
        batchDelete in interface BlueCollection<T extends java.io.Serializable>
        Parameters:
        keys - the keys for the values which will be deleted
        Throws:

                    Mapper<T> mapper)

        Description copied from interface: BlueCollection

        Specified by:
        replace in interface BlueCollection<T extends java.io.Serializable>
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the value which will be replaced
        mapper - a function that returns the value that should replace the value to which the specified key is mapped
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if type of key is not the type specified when the collection was created or if updater throws an exception

      • createIndex

        public <I extends ValueKey> BlueIndex<I,T> createIndex(java.lang.String name,
                                                       java.lang.Class<I> keyType,
                                                       KeyExtractor<I,T> keyExtractor)
                                                throws BlueDbException
        Description copied from interface: BlueCollection
        Creates (or returns existing) BlueIndex that maps objects of type ValueKey (UUIDKey, StringKey, IntegerKey, LongKey) to values in the collection.
        Specified by:
        createIndex in interface BlueCollection<T extends java.io.Serializable>
        Type Parameters:
        I - the key type of the index or the type of data that the collection is being indexed on. It must be a concretion of ValueKey (UUIDKey, StringKey, LongKey, or IntegerKey).
        Parameters:
        name - index name (one index per name per each collection)
        keyType - the type of each key which is used to lookup a value using the index (this must match the keyType of any existing index with the same name)
        keyExtractor - a function that maps a value to the keys by which the value should be indexed. The appropriate subclass can be used and would be more simple to implement. These include UUIDIndexKeyExtractor, StringIndexKeyExtractor, IntegerIndexKeyExtractor, and LongIndexKeyExtractor
        Returns:
        a BlueIndex object (existing index if it exists, otherwise a newly created index)
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if the index exists but is not compatible with these types

      • getIndex

        public <I extends ValueKey> BlueIndex<I,T> getIndex(java.lang.String indexName,
                                                    java.lang.Class<I> keyType)
                                             throws BlueDbException
        Description copied from interface: BlueCollection
        Returns existing BlueIndex that maps objects of type keyType to values in the collection.
        Specified by:
        getIndex in interface BlueCollection<T extends java.io.Serializable>
        Type Parameters:
        I - the key type of the index or the type of data that the collection is being indexed on. It must be a concretion of ValueKey (UUIDKey, StringKey, LongKey, or IntegerKey).
        Parameters:
        indexName - index name (one index per name per each collection)
        keyType - the type of each key which is used to lookup a value using the index (this must match the keyType of any existing index with the same name)
        Returns:
        a BlueIndex with the same name if it exists and has the same keyType
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if index doesn't exist or has a different keyType
